{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3040875,"name":"Martin Pirringer","username":"mpirringer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mpirringer/{size}/124489_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-10T21:47:17.880Z","cooked":"

Hi all

In the past I shared in quite lengthy CD posts. Now that I am “reinventing” myself and also share in other places I have decided to do it through my blog like this

pirringers.com

Rapid React Shooter – Martin's 3D Printing Blog

That way also if a year from now someone asks for something I refer to my blog instead of scrambling to find a post on CD

I am using the shooter as a first try/example. The blogs will try to follow the format of this one. So pics, links to a grabcad folder with stls and Cad files and possibly some youtube videos. There are already some post as to how to tune your printer

I would appreciate comments and critique as to how to improve this. I know I got to improve on the picture taking. Those pics were a rush job on my phone while doing the shooter for someone. The intent is to build a base of 3DP solutions for FRC and FTC and other 3DP related items to allow someone to duplicate what the post outlines. So in this case specify printing size, conditions and as accurate a BOM as possible.
